tomato.name: Tomato
tomato.tip: Ensure good air circulation and avoid overhead watering.
tomato.cause: Caused by the oomycete Phytophthora infestans, thriving in cool, moist conditions.
tomato.funFact: AI models can analyze spectral data from satellite images to detect late blight outbreaks across entire regions before they are visible to the naked eye.

corn.name: Corn
corn.tip: Use resistant hybrids and practice crop rotation.
corn.cause: The fungus Exserohilum turcicum, which overwinters on crop residue.
corn.funFact: AI-powered drones can identify and map infected areas in a cornfield with over 98% accuracy, allowing for targeted fungicide application.

wheat.name: Wheat
wheat.tip: Apply fungicides early and manage nitrogen levels.
wheat.cause: The fungus Blumeria graminis f. sp. tritici, favored by high humidity.
wheat.funFact: Predictive AI models use weather data to forecast powdery mildew outbreaks up to 7 days in advance, giving farmers a critical window for prevention.

cotton.name: Cotton
cotton.cause: The bacterium Xanthomonas citri pv. malvacearum.
cotton.funFact: AI image recognition can differentiate between bacterial blight and fungal spots on cotton leaves, which often look similar to the human eye.

potato.name: Potato
potato.tip: Rotate crops and remove infected plant debris to reduce fungal spores.
potato.cause: The fungus Alternaria solani, which overwinters in soil and on plant debris.
potato.funFact: AI can distinguish between Early Blight and Late Blight with over 99% accuracy by analyzing the specific shape and coloration of leaf lesions.

rice.name: Rice
rice.tip: Use resistant varieties and manage water levels to avoid prolonged leaf wetness.
rice.cause: The fungus Magnaporthe oryzae, one of the most destructive rice pathogens worldwide.
rice.funFact: AI-driven sensor networks in rice paddies monitor humidity and temperature to predict Rice Blast outbreaks, alerting farmers to take preventive action.

soybean.name: Soybean
soybean.tip: Monitor fields closely, especially after rain, and apply fungicides preventatively.
soybean.cause: The fungus Phakospore pachyrhizi, which can be spread long distances by wind.
soybean.funFact: Machine learning models analyze wind patterns and weather data to track the continental spread of soybean rust spores in real-time.
